article.title: Quasiparticles and phonon satellites in spectral functions of semiconductors and insulators: Cumulants applied to full first principles theory and Fröhlich polaron

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the quasiparticle energy of the Fröhlich polaron as a function of the Fröhlich coupling constant. Which method provides the most accurate prediction for the polaron energy across a wide range of coupling constants?

This figure depicts the quasiparticle spectral weight Zk=0 of the Fröhlich polaron as a function of the Fröhlich coupling constant. Which method leads to a physically unreasonable quasiparticle spectral weight as the coupling constant increases?

This figure showcases different Feynman diagrams representing electron-phonon interactions. Which diagram corresponds to the Fan self-energy diagram, which is treated exactly in the lowest-order cumulant approach?
This figure illustrates the Fröhlich Hamiltonian self-energy with different broadening parameters. What is the effect of using a larger broadening factor (η) on the self-energy function?
choices: Sharpens the peaks and shifts them to lower energies.
Broadens the peaks and smooths out the features.
Shifts the peaks to higher energies without changing their shape.
Introduces additional peaks at higher energies.
